title: Opening remarks

author: Yevgeny Seldin, Department of Computer Science, University of Copenhagen

segmentation: So we will start.
The workshop will open the day, so you came to multi tradeoffs in machine Learning Workshop.
And first of all, what this workshop is going to be about?

So we all know about the individual tradeoffs like model order selection, thread of which is the tradeoff between modeling resolution, statistical reliability or exploration, exploitation tradeoff, and so on.
Like when I have to deal just between thread or between two things.
And in this workshop we will go to the cases where we have to deal with more than two objectives.
And.
My favorite example is the sleeping bag problem.
So this sleeping bag problem.
When I was once traveling to New Zealand, I went into a shop and they wanted to buy a sleeping bag and I look at one sleeping bag, second sleeping bag and so on, and I didn't like any of them.
And then this sales assistant assistant he told me look, you want a warm, lightweight and cheap sleeping bag.
I can satisfy any two of these requirements, but not all three of them simultaneously.
So the question what we do where we have more than two objectives that we want to optimize?
And generally it appears when we have multiple tasks that we have to perform, but we have some common resources like computational resources, or if we're talking about robotics, we have a broader.
So if you have a robot that wants.
To ride the bicycle and to balance a pool at the same time so it has to perform two tasks simultaneously, and each task requires some resources from the robot and has to do them at the same time.
It can also be for a single task where we have multiple constraints like time accuracy, sample size and so on.

So if you are lost in the desert and you have your mobile phone to take you out, but it has limited battery and you may use it for longer time initially, maybe you would like to use it in sometime later and so on.
So this is going to be the theme of the workshop.
And so the organizers see again, it's me guys sitting here.
Joshua Taylor is not with us today.
Timer Nicholasa Bianchi Francois Livia that is supposed to arrive a bit later.
Gabbard logos and Peter Bartlett, also sitting here.
And.
Already grateful to our sponsor Pascal two that helped us to sponsor the invited speakers and some of the students that are going to speak here.
And generally this is the schedule, so I'm opening now will have Chaba Giovanni.
Then we have coffee break, Pascal Germanshire Schwartz.
Skybreak hope you all come back after the ski break and we will have young Peterson here.
My shirt and consonant at the end, coffee break and poster session, and I'm giving this into Peter who is chairing the first session.
